intro: We want everyone to enjoy the Dartford Holi Festival. Here's what we've arranged to make the event accessible and comfortable for all.

sections.title: Wheelchair & Mobility Access
items: The Open Air Theatre at Central Park has level access from the main entrance on Park Road
Accessible parking spaces are available in the car park closest to the entrance â€” arrive early as spaces are limited
Hard-standing pathways connect the main stage, food court, and facilities
Grass areas may be uneven â€” our volunteers can assist with navigation
An accessible viewing area is reserved near the front of the main stage

sections.title: Hearing & Deaf Access
items: A BSL (British Sign Language) interpreter will be present for the opening and closing ceremonies
Key announcements will be posted on the announcement board near the Information Tent
Staff at the Information Tent can assist with written communication
Our MC will use clear, facing-the-audience speech patterns during announcements

sections.title: Visual Impairment
items: Sighted guide volunteers are available â€” ask at the Information Tent
Guide dogs are welcome at the event (we recommend protective eyewear for them during colour play)
Large-print programmes are available at the entrance
Audio descriptions of key events will be available on request

sections.title: Quiet Zone & Sensory Needs
items: A designated quiet zone is located in the garden area behind the food court, away from speakers
If you need a break from noise or crowds, volunteers can guide you there
Ear defenders are available to borrow from the Information Tent
The colour play area is clearly marked â€” you can enjoy the festival without entering it

sections.title: Accessible Facilities
items: Accessible portable toilets are located near the main entrance and the food court
Baby changing facilities are available at the Information Tent
Drinking water points are at ground level and accessible
Seating is available throughout the venue â€” look for the bench areas on the map

sections.title: Getting Here
items: Blue Badge parking is available in the Central Park car park off Park Road
Dartford station is a 15-minute walk â€” level route via Park Road
If you need transport assistance, contact the event team in advance via the website
Drop-off point available at the Park Road entrance for those needing closer access

sections.title: Need Help?
items: All volunteer marshals (yellow vests) are trained to assist visitors with accessibility needs
The Information Tent near the entrance is your first point of contact
First Aid staff can provide medical assistance at any time
If you have specific accessibility requirements, please contact us before the event so we can prepare
